verses.verse: And it came <WG1096> to pass, that on <WG1722> one <WG3391> of those <WG1565> days, <WG2250> as he taught <WG1321> the people <WG2992> in the temple, <WG2411> and preached <WG2097> the gospel, <WG2097> the chief <WG749> priests <WG749> and the scribes <WG1122> came <WG2186> on him with the elders, <WG4245>

And spoke <WG2036> to him, saying, <WG3004> Tell <WG2036> us, by what <WG4169> authority <WG1849> do <WG4160> you these <WG5023> things? or <WG2228> who <WG5101> is he that gave <WG1325> you this <WG5026> authority? <WG1849>
And he answered <WG611> and said <WG2036> to them, I will also <WG2504> ask <WG2065> you one <WG1520> thing; <WG3056> and answer <WG2036> me:
The baptism <WG908> of John, <WG2491> was it from heaven, <WG3772> or <WG2228> of men? <WG444>

And they reasoned <WG4817> with themselves, <WG1438> saying, <WG3004> If <WG1437> we shall say, <WG2036> From heaven; <WG3772> he will say, <WG2046> Why <WG1302> then <WG3767> believed <WG4100> you him not?
But and if <WG1437> we say, <WG2036> Of men; <WG444> all <WG3956> the people <WG2992> will stone <WG2642> us: for they be persuaded <WG3982> that John <WG2491> was a prophet. <WG4396>
And they answered, <WG611> that they could <WG3361> not tell <WG1492> from where <WG4159> it was.
And Jesus <WG2424> said <WG2036> to them, Neither <WG3761> tell <WG3004> I you by what <WG4169> authority <WG1849> I do <WG4160> these <WG5023> things.

Then <WG1161> began <WG756> he to speak <WG3004> to the people <WG2992> this <WG5026> parable; <WG3850> A certain <WG5100> man <WG444> planted <WG5452> a vineyard, <WG290> and let <WG1554> it forth <WG1554> to farmers, <WG1092> and went <WG589> into a far country <WG589> for a long <WG2425> time. <WG5550>

And at <WG1722> the season <WG2540> he sent <WG649> a servant <WG1401> to the farmers, <WG1092> that they should give <WG1325> him of the fruit <WG2590> of the vineyard: <WG290> but the farmers <WG1092> beat <WG1194> him, and sent <WG1821> him away <WG1821> empty. <WG2756>

And again <WG4388> he sent <WG3992> another <WG2087> servant: <WG1401> and they beat <WG1194> him also, <WG2548> and entreated <WG818> him shamefully, <WG818> and sent <WG1821> him away <WG1821> empty. <WG2756>
And again <WG4388> he sent <WG3992> a third: <WG5154> and they wounded <WG5135> him also, <WG2532> and cast <WG1544> him out.

Then <WG1161> said <WG2036> the lord <WG2962> of the vineyard, <WG290> What <WG5101> shall I do? <WG4160> I will send <WG3992> my beloved <WG27> son: <WG5207> it may <WG2481> be they will reverence <WG1788> him when they see <WG1492> him.

But when the farmers <WG1092> saw <WG1492> him, they reasoned <WG1260> among <WG4314> themselves, <WG1438> saying, <WG3004> This <WG3778> is the heir: <WG2818> come, <WG1205> let us kill <WG615> him, that the inheritance <WG2817> may be ours. <WG2257>
So <WG2532> they cast <WG1544> him out of the vineyard, <WG290> and killed <WG615> him. What <WG5101> therefore <WG3767> shall the lord <WG2962> of the vineyard <WG290> do <WG4160> to them?

He shall come <WG2064> and destroy <WG622> these <WG5128> farmers, <WG1092> and shall give <WG1325> the vineyard <WG290> to others. <WG243> And when they heard <WG191> it, they said, <WG2036> God <WG3361> <WG1096> forbid. <WG3361> <WG1096>

And he beheld <WG1689> them, and said, <WG2036> What <WG5101> is this <WG5124> then <WG3767> that is written, <WG1125> The stone <WG3037> which <WG3739> the builders <WG3618> rejected, <WG593> the same <WG3778> is become <WG1096> <WG1519> the head <WG2776> of the corner? <WG1137>

Whoever <WG3956> <WG3588> shall fall <WG4098> on that stone <WG3037> shall be broken; <WG4917> but on <WG1909> whomsoever <WG3739> <WG302> it shall fall, <WG4098> it will grind <WG3039> him to powder. <WG3039>

And the chief <WG749> priests <WG749> and the scribes <WG1122> the same <WG846> hour <WG5610> sought <WG2212> to lay <WG1911> hands <WG5495> on <WG1909> him; and they feared <WG5399> the people: <WG2992> for they perceived <WG1097> that he had spoken <WG2036> this <WG5026> parable <WG3850> against <WG4314> them.

And they watched <WG3906> him, and sent <WG649> forth <WG649> spies, <WG1455> which should feign <WG5271> themselves <WG1438> just <WG1342> men, that they might take <WG1949> hold <WG1949> of his words, <WG3056> that so <WG1519> they might deliver <WG3860> him to the power <WG746> and authority <WG1849> of the governor. <WG2230>

And they asked <WG1905> him, saying, <WG3004> Master, <WG1320> we know <WG1492> that you say <WG3004> and teach <WG1321> rightly, <WG3723> neither <WG2532> <WG3756> accept <WG2983> you the person <WG4383> of any, but teach <WG1321> the way <WG3598> of God <WG2316> truly: <WG1909>
Is it lawful <WG1832> for us to give <WG1325> tribute <WG5411> to Caesar, <WG2541> or <WG2228> no? <WG3756>
But he perceived <WG2657> their craftiness, <WG3834> and said <WG2036> to them, Why <WG5101> tempt <WG3985> you me?
Show <WG1925> me a penny. <WG1220> Whose <WG5100> image <WG1504> and superscription <WG1923> has <WG2192> it? They answered <WG611> and said, <WG2036> Caesar's. <WG2541>
And he said <WG2036> to them, Render <WG591> therefore <WG5106> to Caesar <WG2541> the things which be Caesar's, <WG2541> and to God <WG2316> the things which be God's. <WG2316>

And they could <WG2480> not take <WG1949> hold <WG1949> of his words <WG4487> before <WG1726> the people: <WG2992> and they marveled <WG2296> at <WG1909> his answer, <WG612> and held <WG4601> their peace. <WG4601>
Then <WG1161> came <WG4334> to him certain <WG5100> of the Sadducees, <WG4523> which <WG3588> deny <WG483> that there is any <WG3361> resurrection; <WG386> and they asked <WG1905> him,

Saying, <WG3004> Master, <WG1320> Moses <WG3475> wrote <WG1125> to us, If <WG1437> any <WG5100> man's <WG5100> brother <WG80> die, <WG599> having <WG2192> a wife, <WG1135> and he die <WG599> without <WG815> children, <WG815> that his brother <WG80> should take <WG2983> his wife, <WG1135> and raise <WG1817> up seed <WG4690> to his brother. <WG80>
There were therefore <WG3767> seven <WG2033> brothers: <WG80> and the first <WG4413> took <WG2983> a wife, <WG1135> and died <WG599> without <WG815> children. <WG815>
And the second <WG1208> took <WG2983> her to wife, <WG1135> and he died <WG599> childless. <WG815>
And the third <WG5154> took <WG2983> her; and in like <WG5615> manner <WG5615> the seven <WG2033> also: <WG2532> and they left <WG2641> no <WG3756> children, <WG5043> and died. <WG599>
Last <WG5305> of all <WG3956> the woman <WG1135> died <WG599> also. <WG2532>
Therefore <WG3767> in the resurrection <WG386> whose <WG5100> wife <WG1135> of them is she? for seven <WG2033> had <WG2192> her to wife. <WG1135>
And Jesus <WG2424> answering <WG611> said <WG2036> to them, The children <WG5207> of this <WG5126> world <WG165> marry, <WG1060> and are given in marriage: <WG1548>

But they which shall be accounted <WG2661> worthy <WG2661> to obtain <WG5177> that world, <WG165> and the resurrection <WG386> from the dead, <WG3498> neither <WG3777> marry, <WG1060> nor <WG3777> are given in marriage: <WG1548>

Neither <WG3777> can <WG1410> they die <WG599> any <WG2089> more: <WG2089> for they are equal <WG2465> to the angels; <WG2465> and are the children <WG5207> of God, <WG2316> being <WG5607> the children <WG5207> of the resurrection. <WG386>

Now <WG1161> that the dead <WG3498> are raised, <WG1453> even <WG2532> Moses <WG3475> showed <WG3377> at <WG1909> the bush, <WG942> when <WG5613> he calls <WG3004> the Lord <WG2962> the God <WG2316> of Abraham, <WG11> and the God <WG2316> of Isaac, <WG2464> and the God <WG2316> of Jacob. <WG2384>
For he is not a God <WG2316> of the dead, <WG3498> but of the living: <WG2198> for all <WG3956> live <WG2198> to him.
Then <WG1161> certain <WG5100> of the scribes <WG1122> answering <WG611> said, <WG2036> Master, <WG1320> you have well <WG2573> said. <WG2036>
And after <WG2089> that they dared <WG5111> not ask <WG1905> him any <WG3762> question at all.
And he said <WG2036> to them, How <WG4459> say <WG2036> they that Christ <WG5547> is David's <WG1138> son? <WG5207>
And David <WG1138> himself <WG846> said <WG3004> in the book <WG976> of Psalms, <WG5568> The LORD <WG2962> said <WG2036> to my Lord, <WG2962> Sit <WG2521> you on <WG1537> my right <WG1188> hand,
Till <WG2193> I make <WG5087> your <WG4675> enemies <WG2190> your footstool. <WG5286>
David <WG1138> therefore calls <WG2564> him Lord, <WG2962> how <WG4459> is he then <WG2532> his son? <WG5207>
Then <WG1161> in the audience <WG191> of all <WG3956> the people <WG2992> he said <WG2036> to his disciples, <WG3101>

Beware <WG4337> of the scribes, <WG1122> which <WG3588> desire <WG2309> to walk <WG4043> in long robes, <WG4749> and love <WG5368> greetings <WG783> in the markets, <WG58> and the highest <WG4410> seats <WG4410> in the synagogues, <WG4864> and the chief <WG4411> rooms <WG4411> at <WG1722> feasts; <WG1173>

Which <WG3739> devour <WG2719> widows' <WG5503> houses, <WG3614> and for a show <WG4392> make <WG4336> long <WG3117> prayers: <WG4336> the same <WG3778> shall receive <WG2983> greater <WG4055> damnation. <WG2917>
